title: Nathan Jacobs, Nones, LIfe Itself, Stranger than Fiction, Karma, Life after Death, the Trinity
description:
In my second talk with Nathan we start to get into the shape of unbelief of post-Christian Nones. The movies "Life Itself" and "Stranger than Fiction" illustrate two aspects the conflict between the impersonality of their weakened Karma, their desire for justice and meaning. I want to know what a "person" is which leads to a very long explanation of the difference between Augustine, Boethius, and the Eastern Fathers on the Trinity and why it matters. Lots of analysis of contemporary post-Christian unbelief, philosophy and theology. We'll talk again because we're only starting to explore.
